entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 27 at 5:52PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...TAKU RIVER HAS CRESTED FROM SECOND GLACIAL DAM RELEASE THIS SEASON... The Taku River east of Juneau crested at 12:45 PM Wednesday at 38.1 feet. Waters will fall through the next 24 hours. Expect some debris to flow down the river at times through the next day or so. No flooding is expected.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Juneau Borough and Northern Admiralty Island

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 27 at 2:18PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Strong Winds Through Thursday Afternoon... West winds gusting to 50 mph will continue through Thursday afternoon.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 27 at 2:18PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Snow Above 2000 Feet today through Thursday afternoon... Between 3 and 5 inches of snow is expected above 2000 feet through Thursday afternoon. This includes the Dalton Highway from Sagwon to Atigun Pass. The snow will continue tonight and Thursday before tapering off Thursday afternoon.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 27 at 11:55AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...GLACIER DAM LAKE RELEASE ONGOING FOR SALMON RIVER NEAR HYDER... The Salmon River has been rising since Sunday due to rain and snow melt, but saw a sharper rate of rise on Tuesday of around half a foot every 6 hours, indicating that Summit Lake was draining. The water level on the Salmon River should crest Wednesday or Thursday, however inherent uncertainty in these events result in varying crest

entry.title: Severe Weather Statement issued July 27 at 8:42PM MDT until July 27 at 9:30PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...THE SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING FOR SOUTHWESTERN GOSHEN AND SOUTHEASTERN PLATTE COUNTIES WILL EXPIRE AT 845 PM MDT... The storm which prompted the warning has moved out of the area. Therefore, the warning will be allowed to expire. However gusty winds and heavy rain are still possible with this thunderstorm.

entry.title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 27 at 8:40PM MDT until July 27 at 9:30PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: The National Weather Service in Cheyenne has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southwestern Goshen County in southeastern Wyoming... North central Laramie County in southeastern Wyoming... Southeastern Platte County in southeastern Wyoming... * Until 930 PM MDT.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 27 at 8:31PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Goshen and east central Platte Counties through 900 PM MDT... At 831 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles southeast of Grayrocks Reservoir, or 19 miles east of Wheatland, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 27 at 8:16PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Fremont County through 900 PM MDT... At 816 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Ethete, or near Fort Washakie, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated.

entry.title: Red Flag Warning issued July 27 at 1:17PM MDT until July 28 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 9 PM MDT THURSDAY... The National Weather Service in Riverton has issued a Red Flag Warning, which is in effect from noon to 9 PM MDT Thursday. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * IMPACTS: Increasing Thunderstorm Activity will create erratic fire behavior and new fire starts.
